title: Don’t Panic! Kolkata’s AJC Bose Flyover Is Not Collapsing
subtitle: Almost a month after the Majerhat bridge in Kolkata collapsed, a video of the AJC flyover in the city did the rounds on Thursday, 4 October, with similar claims of debris and dust falling off the side of the flyover.
author: www.thequint.com
vclaim:
The claims behind the video are false. The dust and debris seen dropping from the flyover were reportedly due to the sweepers clearing the road, and pushing the excess dust down the drain pipe, which landed on the road below, clarified Kolkata Police.

It is clarified that the men employed for cleaning the AJC Road Flyover had swept the road and pushed the dust through the drain pipe on the Flyover and this was recorded.



There is no cause for panic. (2/2) — Kolkata Police (@KolkataPolice) October 4, 2018

Meanwhile, another user on Twitter also claimed that the debris were due to some construction work that was underway in a bid to connect a ramp to the adjoining Ma flyover.

Don't panic... the edge of the AJC Bose flyover is being cut to connect a ramp from Ma Flyover. pic.twitter.com/iSoLqmGxUU — Jawed Chowdhury #Happily Indian (@jawedchowdhury) October 4, 2018
